newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to invite tenders for 5,000 tonnes of pork.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to invite tenders for 5,000 tonnes of pork.

text.p: South Korea will invite tenders for a total of 5,000 tonnes of pork in October to ease domestic prices, an official at the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry said on Friday.

The purchase is over and above South Korea's Minimum Market Access requirement of 23,392 tonnes this year under World Trade Organisation rules. South Korea has already bought exactly that amount, a ministry official said.
The official said Denmark had supplied 50 percent of the minimum access requirement, the United States 17 percent and the rest came from Britain and the Netherlands.
The ministry on Thursday instructed the National Livestock Cooperative Federation to go ahead with the tenders.
A total of 3,000 tonnes will be invited for early October to cover an expected shortage following the Korean Thanksgiving holiday from September 26 to 29 when demand for meat rises.
Delivery for that consignment will be early November. Tenders for the other 2,000 tonnes would be held later in October, the official said.
The government has already announced it will open the pork market from July next year.
In the first six months of next year, before the liberalisation takes effect, South Korea will import 14,620 tonnes of pork, the official said.
Last year South Korea imported 17,544 tonnes of pork under minimum market access requirements.
